paper.title: Directed Acyclic Graphs, One-way Functions and Digital Signatures
paper.abstract: The goals of this paper are to formalize and investigate the general concept of a digital signature scheme based on a general one-way function without trapdoor for signing a predetermined number of messages. It generalizes and unifies previous work of Lamport, Winternitz, Merkle, Even et al. and Vaudenay. The structure of the computation yielding a public key from a secret key corresponds to a directed acyclic graph G. A signature scheme for G can be defined as an antichain in the poset of minimal verifyable sets of vertices of G with the naturally defined computability relation as the order relation and where a set is verifyable if and only if the public key can be computed from the set.
